intro: Selago buchananii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Selago buchananii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and resilience to coastal climates.
